sections.purpose: To measure the relative humidity and ambient temperature in the laboratory.
sections.scope: Applicable to environmental monitoring in Pharmaceutical Chemistry.
procedure: Place the hygrometer in a location representative of the room environment.
Ensure the sensor is not obstructed by equipment or furniture.
Allow the device to stabilize for at least 30 minutes before taking a reading.
Read the relative humidity (%) and temperature (Â°C) from the display.
Record the values in the daily environmental logbook.
Compare the readings with the specified limits for the laboratory.
Report any deviations from the humidity range (typically 40-60%) to the supervisor.
precautions: Do not place the hygrometer near humidifiers or air conditioners.
Avoid exposing the sensor to chemical fumes or extreme dust.
Verify the accuracy of the hygrometer annually with a certified reference.
Replace batteries as soon as the display becomes faint.
Handle the device with care to prevent mechanical shock.
